title: Cross-Domain Usability Assessment of LLMs in Educational Settings
description: Investigate the usability of LLMs in educational environments, focusing on their ability to support cross-domain learning and provide explainable recommendations.
motivation: LLMs have shown potential in educational settings, but their cross-domain usability and explainability remain underexplored. Understanding these aspects can enhance their integration into educational tools.
milestones: Conduct literature review to understand current LLM usability in education.
Define specific educational domains for cross-domain analysis.
Develop evaluation criteria for usability and explainability.
Design a methodology for testing LLMs in the selected domains.
Conduct initial usability testing with selected participants.
Collect and analyze data from initial tests.
Refine methodology based on initial findings.
Conduct expanded usability testing across multiple domains.
Collect and analyze data from expanded tests.
Generate a report on findings from usability tests.
Develop recommendations for LLM deployment in educational settings.
Draft a comprehensive report on the entire study.
Review and revise the report based on feedback from peers.
Submit the final report and presentation.
